intro: Costus tarapotensis, commonly known as the Andean costus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric, and is characterized by its ornamental leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its rhizomatous growth habit makes it a resilient and adaptable species in its native habitat.
